page.title: 01MIDDLETON:GREATER MANCHESTER
page.content: Middleton is an Industrial Town in the Metropolitan Borough of Rochdale, approx. 6 miles from Manchester and 3 miles from Oldham. Cotton and silk were the town's main industry during the 19th Century, but have been replaced by chemicals, engineering, plastics and tobacco. Middleton has a large Arndale Centre, which was opened in October 1971, and many other shops. There is a market on Friday and Saturday and early closing day is Tuesday. Middleton has a large Civic Hall, swimming pool and recreation centre. The Palace Cinema is used as a cinema and a bingo hall. The population in 1981 was c.51,500. There is a large Manchester overspill housing estate at Langley.
